[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: filter_transactions()] [Parallel filtering race] If filter_transactions is called concurrently with filter modifications, can this cause inconsistent filtering results? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: allows_transaction()] [TOCTOU vulnerability] Is there a time-of-check-time-of-use race between checking allows_transaction and actually processing the transaction? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: filter_transactions()] [Memory exhaustion] Can an attacker cause excessive memory consumption by submitting large batches of transactions to filter_transactions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: allows_transaction()] [Algorithmic complexity] Can an attacker craft transactions that trigger worst-case performance in the rule matching logic, causing DoS? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Struct: TransactionFilter] [Rule list DoS] Can attackers exploit unbounded rule lists to cause excessive iteration time in allows_transaction? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: compare_entry_function()] [Unicode normalization] Are module and function name comparisons vulnerable to Unicode normalization attacks (e.g., 'transfer' vs 'trаnsfer' with Cyrillic 'а')? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: compare_entry_function()] [String interning bypass] Can string interning or caching issues cause identical strings to compare as different, bypassing filters? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: compare_entry_function()] [Null byte injection] Can null bytes or other special characters in module/function names bypass string comparison logic? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Enum: TransactionMatcher] [Enum exhaustiveness] Do all match statements on TransactionMatcher explicitly handle all variants, or can new variants bypass filters? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Enum: TransactionPayload] [Payload exhaustiveness] Are all TransactionPayload variants handled in every relevant function, or can new variants fall through to default false? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Enum: AccountAuthenticator] [Authenticator exhaustiveness] Do authenticator matching functions explicitly handle all variants, or will future variants bypass checks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: matches() - TransactionMatcher::TransactionId] [Hash collision resistance] Is the committed_hash() function collision-resistant enough to prevent attackers from generating matching transaction IDs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: compare_ed25519_public_key()] [Public key validation] Are Ed25519 public keys validated for cryptographic correctness, or can invalid keys match legitimate ones through comparison? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: matches_transaction_authenticator_public_key()] [Signature verification bypass] Does public key matching occur before or after signature verification, and can this ordering be exploited? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: compare_entry_function()] [Empty string handling] Can empty module names or function names bypass entry function filters through comparison edge cases? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: matches_account_authenticator_address()] [Zero address] Does the filter properly handle the zero address (0x0), or can it be exploited for special bypass behavior? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: filter_transactions()] [Empty transaction list] Does filter_transactions handle empty input vectors correctly, or can it cause unexpected behavior? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: matches_transaction_authenticator_address()] [Empty secondary signers] Can empty secondary signer arrays bypass multi-agent and fee payer address checks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: matches_account_authenticator_address() - NoAccountAuthenticator] [Missing authentication] Does NoAccountAuthenticator always returning false create a bypass for transactions without proper authentication? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: matches_account_authenticator_public_key() - NoAccountAuthenticator] [Unauthenticated key bypass] Can transactions with NoAccountAuthenticator bypass all public key filtering, allowing unauthenticated transactions? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: matches_account_authenticator_address() - Abstract] [Abstract authenticator exploitation] Can Abstract authenticators with manipulated function_info be used to match any target address, bypassing address filters? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: matches_account_authenticator_public_key() - MultiEd25519] [Threshold bypass] Can an attacker include blocked keys in a MultiEd25519 authenticator and still pass filters if other keys are legitimate, bypassing key-based filters? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: matches_account_authenticator_address() - MultiKey] [MultiKey threshold exploitation] Can MultiKey authenticators with mixed legitimate/malicious keys bypass address filters through the any() check logic? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: matches_transaction_authenticator_address() - MultiAgent] [Secondary signer manipulation] Can attackers bypass filters by using blocked addresses as secondary signers rather than the primary sender? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: matches_transaction_authenticator_address() - FeePayer] [Fee payer address bypass] Can attackers use blocked addresses as fee payers while using legitimate addresses as senders to bypass filters? (High)
